brief_summary.textblock:
This study is about the evaluation of which benefits single port laparoscopic myomectomy has
      in the perspective of cosmetics and patient satisfaction.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single Port Myomectomy Versus Conventional Myomectomy

detailed_description.textblock:
There were several studies about feasibility and cosmetic benefit of single port
      laparoscopic adnexal surgery and hysterectomy compared to conventional multiport
      laparoscopic surgery. Meanwhile, no study mentioned benefit of single port laparoscopic
      surgery in myomectomy because single port myomectomy needs more labor and operator's skill
      than other pelvic surgery. At this point, the investigators need to verify the effectiveness
      and benefit of single port laparoscopic myomectomy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  premenopausal women

          -  image confirmed myoma

          -  scheduled to have laparoscopic myomectomy

          -  number of myoma =<4 and largest size <10cm

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  scheduled to have co-operation of other surgery

          -  clinically significant hematologic abnormality

          -  DM or malnutrition

          -  under the medication which can affect wound healing

          -  previous history of other pelvic surgery

intervention.description: using only one port for laparoscopic surgery
intervention.intervention_name: using only one port for laparoscopic surgery

facility.name: Seoul University Bundang Hospital OB & GY

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Randomized Controlled Trial to Analyze the Benefits of Single Port Laparoscopic Myomectomy in the View of Cosmetics and Patient Satisfaction

primary_outcome.description: The characteristics of scar such as color, pliability, and stiffness are willing to be measured in 1 week and 8 week later after myomectomy. The level of satisfaction of patients will also be evaluated.
primary_outcome.measure: Cosmetic benefits of single port laparoscopic myomectomy to conventional myomectomy in the view of scar evaluation

primary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction about scar formation after myomectomy are willing to be evaluated after surgery.
primary_outcome.measure: Cosmetic benefits of single port laparoscopic myomectomy to conventional myomectomy in the view of patient satisfaction

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Composite parameters about surgery outcome and complication such as Op time, Drop of Hb, postop pain, duration of hospital stay, intraop complication, postop complication are willing to be measured.
secondary_outcome.measure: General composite characteristics of surgery procedure and outcome

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
